tool_description: The ScamPredictor API offers insights into the reliability of websites, domain names, and email addresses, using the same trusted system as Scamdoc.com. It is designed to provide real-time evaluations to help users make informed decisions about the credibility of online entities.
name: ScamPredictor
title: ScamPredictor

api_list.name: Domain_trustscore
api_list.description:
The **Domain_trustscore** endpoint in the ScamPredictor API is specifically designed to assess the credibility of internet domain names. This endpoint functions as a GET request, where the parameter required is the domain name of the website in question.

## Key Features:

- **Request Type**: GET
- **Parameter**: Domain - The domain name for evaluation.

## Scam Probability Indicator:

- **Class System**: The endpoint returns a class ranging from 1 to 5, where a lower class (closer to 1) indicates a higher legitimacy, and a higher class (closer to 5) signifies a greater scam risk.
-** Score System**: The score ranges from 0 to 1. A lower score (closer to 0) denotes greater trustworthiness of the domain, whereas a higher score (closer to 1) suggests a higher likelihood of the domain being involved in scam activities.

This system ensures that users can easily understand the level of risk associated with a particular website domain, with lower scores or classes indicating a safer and more trustworthy domain.

api_list.name: Email_trustscore
api_list.description:
The **Email_trustscore** endpoint of the ScamPredictor API provides a crucial measure indicating the probability of an email being a scam. In this system, both the class and score inversely relate to the email's legitimacy.

## Scam Probability Indicator:

- **Class System**: Ranges from 1 to 5, where a lower class number (closer to 1) signifies higher legitimacy, and a higher class number (closer to 5) indicates a higher risk of scam.
- **Score System**: Operates on a scale from 0 to 1, with a lower score (closer to 0) denoting higher trustworthiness, and a higher score (closer to 1) suggesting a greater likelihood of being a scam.

This means that when using the ScamPredictor API, a lower class or score is preferable as it indicates a lower probability of the email being fraudulent, thereby signifying higher trust and safety.
